body:
Interesting, I can see the method being listed as public:

```ruby
>> Rails::Generators::NamedBase.public_instance_methods.sort.grep /singular/
=> [:singular_name]
>> Rails::Generators::NamedBase.protected_instance_methods.sort.grep /singular/
=> [:singular_table_name]
```

But I can't seem to reproduce the same with this (quick and dirty):

```ruby
class Foo
  attr_reader :pub

  protected
  attr_reader :prot
  alias protalias prot
  alias_method :protaliasmethod, :prot

  private
  attr_reader :priv
  alias privalias priv
  alias_method :privaliasmethod, :priv
end

f = Foo.new

puts "Public"
f.pub

puts

puts "Protected"
f.prot rescue puts $!.message
puts "Protected alias"
f.protalias rescue puts $!.message
puts "Protected alias_method"
f.protaliasmethod rescue puts $!.message

puts

puts "Private"
f.priv rescue puts $!.message
puts "Private alias"
f.privalias rescue puts $!.message
puts "Private alias_method"
f.privaliasmethod rescue puts $!.message

=begin
Public

Protected
protected method `prot' called for #<Foo:0x007f8eea1d35f0>
Protected alias
protected method `protalias' called for #<Foo:0x007f8eea1d35f0>
Protected alias_method
protected method `protaliasmethod' called for #<Foo:0x007f8eea1d35f0>

Private
private method `priv' called for #<Foo:0x007f8eea1d35f0>
Private alias
private method `privalias' called for #<Foo:0x007f8eea1d35f0>
Private alias_method
private method `privaliasmethod' called for #<Foo:0x007f8eea1d35f0>
=end
```

This smells like there's something else interfering, unless I'm missing something.
